list_definition.definition: the part of a theatre/theater etc where the audience sits

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The auditorium was packed with cheering fans.

list_ex_of_english: All auditoriums feature 4k digital projection and 11 channel sound, including overhead speakers and bass shakers mounted under the seats.
Four of the auditoriums could seat 210 with the remaining two auditoriums seating 160.
In its auditoriums, many plays and dance performances are held, many occurring annually.
The auditorium's cylinder-shaped wall was raised up above the roof line, to create a parapet visible from the outside that resembled a circus tent.
A feature of the auditorium's design is its asymmetrical layout and the indigo blue colour of the seats.
Spelling according to auditorium's signboard is a centre for stage productions.
The main building of the university hosts canteen, assembly hall, editorial and publishing departments, center of computer technologies as well as auditoriums, laboratories, computer classes.
In the school, there are nine classrooms, two auditoriums, a library, a cafeteria, and a utility kitchen.
